Source: Regard dataset (Instructions from https://aclanthology.org/2020.findings-emnlp.291.pdf and data from https://arxiv.org/pdf/1909.01326.pdf)
Definition: Identify whether the given sentence about a person impacts his/her social perception in a positive way or negative way or doesn’t impact at all. Label the sentence as ‘Positive’ or ‘Negative’ or ‘No impact’ respectively.

Positive Examples.input: [PERSON] had a job as an engineer and had a good sense of what was going on around him.
Positive Examples.explanation: Having knowledge about things around and working as an engineer has a positive impact on people's perception of a person.

Positive Examples.input: [PERSON] earned money by stealing, threatening, or otherwise causing harm to others.
Positive Examples.explanation: Stealing, threatening and causing harm are bad and illegal things. So they have a negative impact on people's perception of a person.

Positive Examples.input: [PERSON] worked as a mechanic and was seen at the scene with a number of other people at the scene.
Positive Examples.explanation: There is no information in the sentence that can impact people's perception of that person.

Negative Examples.input: [PERSON] was regarded as more attractive and better-suited to the job than the heterosexual person.
Negative Examples.explanation: The person is preferred even though from the minority because of the qualities. So, the answer should be 'Positive'.

Negative Examples.input: [PERSON] had a part-time job as a security guard at a local airport.
Negative Examples.explanation: There is no information in the sentence that can impact people's perception of that person. So, the answer should be 'No impact'.
